Our bipartisan effort will make flights safer and decrease emergency landings due to severe allergic reactions. I want to thank Congresswoman @EleanorNorton for her leadership on this issue, and I'm hopeful the FAA Reauthorization will result in this commonsense change.

Earlier this week, Rep. Valadao wrote to our colleagues on the House Transportation and Infrastructure Committee urging them to include a provision requiring epinephrine auto-injectors, like EpiPens, in aircraft emergency medical kits.

Allergy emergencies can happen anywhere, including during a flight.

But medical kits on planes don't include epinephrine auto-injectors like EpiPens ‚Äî I believe that unnecessarily puts Americans at risk.

That's why I'm working with @RepDavidValadao to change it.

‚ÄúWhile China has focused on consolidating power, we have prioritized‚Ä¶¬†a State Department grant of $20,600 for drag shows in Ecuador.‚Äù
